alert.note: Alert for Admiralty Island; City and Borough of Sitka; Western Kupreanof and Kuiu Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 23 at 1:53PM AKST until February 25 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...SNOW BEGINNING THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY... .A strengthening low with embedded waves will move into the NE gulf Thursday evening with an associated front moving over the panhandle Friday. Dry snow will spread from north to south across the panhandle. The snow will largely fall in two separate waves. A first, and weaker, wave will move through during Thursday night and early Friday morning. A brief lull may be possible Friday morning for some locations before a much stronger wave moves into the panhandle, bringing with it substantially more snow. Some uncertainty exists regarding snow totals due to limited moisture available, particularly for parts of the northern and central inner channels. For most areas the greatest snowfall rates will be Friday evening through early Saturday morning. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 9 AM AKST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...City and Borough of Sitka, Admiralty Island and Western Kupreanof Island and Kuiu Island including Angoon, Kake, and Port Alexander. * WHEN...From midnight tonight to 9 AM AKST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Light, dry, snow will fall Thursday night then greater rates are expected Friday afternoon and evening. Some mixing with rain is likely near Port Alexander Friday night.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling.

area.areaDesc: Admiralty Island; City and Borough of Sitka; Western Kupreanof and Kuiu Island
